meanings.sent1: The fence will enclose the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the castle enclose the royal family safely.
meanings.sent3: I tried to enclose my excitement about the surprise party, but I couldn't stop smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her love seemed to enclose me like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave seemed to enclose us in its eerie embrace.

meanings.sent1: Please enclose your payment with the order form.
meanings.sent2: I will enclose a copy of the contract for your records.
meanings.sent3: I always enclose a little note with my gifts to make them more personal.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to enclose the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies seemed to enclose the kitchen in a delicious hug.

meanings.sent1: She will enclose the fragile vase in bubble wrap before packing it.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry box can enclose all your precious gems safely.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally enclose my keys in the drawer and couldn't find them for hours.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to enclose a hidden message that only she could decipher.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fireplace seemed to enclose the room in a cozy embrace.
